verses.kjv: And David consulted with the captains of thousands and hundreds, and with every leader.
verses.ct: David met with his commanders over units of 1,000 and 100, and with every other leader.

verses.kjv: And David said unto all the congregation of Israel, If it seem good unto you, and that it be of the LORD our God, let us send abroad unto our brethren every where, that are left in all the land of Israel, and with them also to the priests and Levites which are in their cities and suburbs, that they may gather themselves unto us:
verses.ct: David addressed the entire assembly of Israel: 'If you agree, and if this is the will of the LORD our God, let us send word to our brothers throughout all the land of Israel — including the priests and Levites in their towns and surrounding areas — inviting them to join us.

verses.kjv: And let us bring again the ark of our God to us: for we enquired not at it in the days of Saul.
verses.ct: Let us bring the ark of our God back to us, because we never sought it during Saul's reign.'

verses.kjv: And all the congregation said that they would do so: for the thing was right in the eyes of all the people.
verses.ct: The whole assembly agreed to do this, because everyone thought it was the right thing to do.

verses.kjv: So David gathered all Israel together, from Shihor of Egypt even unto the entering of Hemath, to bring the ark of God from Kirjathjearim.
verses.ct: So David assembled all of Israel, from the Shihor River near Egypt all the way to the entrance of Hamath, to bring the ark of God from Kirjathjearim.

verses.kjv: And David went up, and all Israel, to Baalah, that is, to Kirjathjearim, which belonged to Judah, to bring up thence the ark of God the LORD, that dwelleth between the cherubims, whose name is called on it.
verses.ct: David and all Israel went up to Baalah — that is, Kirjathjearim — which belonged to Judah, to bring back the ark of God the LORD, who is enthroned between the cherubim, the ark that bears his name.

verses.kjv: And they carried the ark of God in a new cart out of the house of Abinadab: and Uzza and Ahio drave the cart.
verses.ct: They transported the ark of God on a new cart from Abinadab's house, with Uzza and Ahio guiding the cart.

verses.kjv: And David and all Israel played before God with all their might, and with singing, and with harps, and with psalteries, and with timbrels, and with cymbals, and with trumpets.
verses.ct: David and all Israel celebrated in God's presence with all their energy — with singing, harps, lyres, tambourines, cymbals, and trumpets.

verses.kjv: And when they came unto the threshingfloor of Chidon, Uzza put forth his hand to hold the ark; for the oxen stumbled.
verses.ct: When they arrived at the threshing floor of Chidon, the oxen stumbled, and Uzza reached out his hand to steady the ark.

verses.kjv: And the anger of the LORD was kindled against Uzza, and he smote him, because he put his hand to the ark: and there he died before God.
verses.ct: The LORD's anger burned against Uzza, and he struck him down because he had touched the ark. Uzza died right there in God's presence.

verses.kjv: And David was displeased, because the LORD had made a breach upon Uzza: wherefore that place is called Perezuzza to this day.
verses.ct: David was upset because the LORD had broken out against Uzza. That is why that place has been called Perezuzza to this day.

verses.kjv: And David was afraid of God that day, saying, How shall I bring the ark of God home to me?
verses.ct: David was afraid of God that day and said, 'How can I ever bring the ark of God to my home?'

verses.kjv: So David brought not the ark home to himself to the city of David, but carried it aside into the house of Obededom the Gittite.
verses.ct: So David did not move the ark to his own city. Instead, he had it taken to the house of Obededom the Gittite.

verses.kjv: And the ark of God remained with the family of Obededom in his house three months. And the LORD blessed the house of Obededom, and all that he had.
verses.ct: The ark of God stayed with Obededom's family in his house for 3 months, and the LORD blessed Obededom's household and everything he owned.
